SEARCH
Module org.klojang.jdbc
Package org.klojang.jdbc.util

Class SQLTypeUtil

java.lang.Object
org.klojang.jdbc.util.SQLTypeUtil
public final class SQLTypeUtil extends Object
Utility class for translating between the names and values of the constants in the java.sql.Types class. The Types class screams out to be an enum type, but this class predates the introduction of enums into the Java language. The constants represent SQL datatypes like VARCHAR and TIMESTAMP, and there are a lot of them in the Types class. Therefore, knowing that you are dealing, say, with type 12 will likely not be very helpful. This class lets you look up the name of the corresponding constant. (For the curious: 12 is the value of the VARCHAR constant.)

  • Method Details

    • getTypeName

      public static String getTypeName(int sqlType)
      Returns the name of the constant with the specified value. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if there is no constant with the specified value in the Types class.
      Parameters:
      sqlType - the value of the constant whose name you want to retrieve
      Returns:
      the name of the constant with the specified value

    • isValidValue

      public static boolean isValidValue(int sqlType)
      Returns true if the specified integer is the value of one of the constants in java.sql.Types, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      sqlType - the integer value to check
      Returns:
      true if the integer is the value of one of the constants in the Types class, false otherwise

    • forName

      public static int forName(String name)
      Returns the value of the constant with the specified name. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if there is no constant with the specified name in the Types class.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the constant (e.g. "VARCHAR" or "TIMESTAMP")
      Returns:
      the value of the constant with the specified name

    • isValidName

      public static boolean isValidName(String name)
      Returns true if the specified string is the name of one of the constants in the Types class, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      name - the string value to check
      Returns:
      true if the specified string is the name of one of the constants in the Types class, false otherwise

    • getAllValues

      public static int[] getAllValues()
      Returns the values of all constants in ascending order.
      Returns:
      the values of all constants in ascending order

    • getAllNames

      public static String[] getAllNames()
      Returns the names of all constants, sorted alphabetically.
      Returns:
      the names of all constants, sorted alphabetically

    • printAllValues

      public static void printAllValues(PrintStream out)
      Prints the values of all constants in ascending order of the values of the constants. For each value, the name of the constant is printed next to it.
      Parameters:
      out - the PrintStream to write to

    • printAllNames

      public static void printAllNames(PrintStream out)
      Prints the names all constants, sorted alphabetically. For each name, the value of the constant is printed next to it.
      Parameters:
      out - the PrintStream to write to

    • getNonValue

      public static int getNonValue()
      Returns an int value that is guaranteed not to be the value of any of the constants in the java.sql.Types class. Could be used as an initialization value or as a pseudo-null value.
      Returns:
      an int value that is guaranteed not to be the value of any of the constants in the Types java.sql.Types class
